page.title: 12LANGUAGE OF M.W./SHIPT.
page.content: Market Weighton and Shiptonthorpe are situated in the Old East Riding of Yorkshire which has since been renamed as the County of Humberside. Both towns are increasing in size and population, which bring a variety of different regional accents. However, these accents are beginning to thicken and change as time goes by. The people who have lived in Yorkshire for many years have strong East Yorkshire accents, but with the increasing number of newcomers, the original accent is gradually becoming contaminated. Examples of typical Yorkshire phrases used locally are: "nowt" instead of"nothing", "owt" instead of "anything", and "I aren't" instead of "I am not". And the future? The original Yorkshire accent will disappear as less people speak it.
